Description: Rim sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: reserved band at top of rim, glazed black below; top of lip glazed; exterior: lip and handle zone reserved with band between; dilute lines on lip; glazed below; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type A2 (possibly)
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer identifies this sherd as coming from a Type 5C South Ionian cup with everted rim. These cups are both the earliest South Ionian cups at Naukratis and are relatively rare at the site. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18), Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116), and and Vallet and Villard's Ionian Cup Type A2 or B2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). Type 5 cups have been found in large numbers in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 110)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 649, no. 72)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 258, no. 12)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 50, no. 8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.085) (Phase 3)
